heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 09 November 2025 with a total accumulation of 47.89mm over 144.8 hours and falling at a rate of 24.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 34.3mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 0 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The ongoing windy stretch, 4 days and counting started on 02 February 2026 and ranks 5th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 218 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 218.2m lower than yesterday, 4.2m lower than the past week, 3.6m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 530m and a high of 1993m, averaging 792.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
